content:
GeometryCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of Geometry objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class GeometryCollection : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Windows.Media.Geometry>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Media.Geometry>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Windows.Media.Geometry>, System.Collections.IList

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • DependencyObject
  • Freezable
  • System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable
  • GeometryCollection

Remarks

A GeometryCollection is not itself a composite geometry, but is used by the GeometryGroup class to store Geometry objects.

XAML Implicit Collection Usage

<object>  
  <object.property>  
    oneOrMoreGeometryObjectElements  
  </object.property>  
</object>

XAML Values

oneOrMoreGeometryObjectElements
One or more Geometry objects, declared using object element syntax.

Constructors summary

GeometryCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the GeometryCollection class.
GeometryCollection(IEnumerable<Geometry>)

Initializes a new instance of the GeometryCollection class with the specified collection of Geometry objects.
GeometryCollection(Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the GeometryCollection class with the specified capacity, or the number of Geometry objects the collection is initially capable of storing.

Properties summary

Count

Gets the number of geometries contained in the GeometryCollection.
Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the Geometry at the specified index position.

Methods summary

Add(Geometry)

Adds a Geometry to the end of the collection.
Clear()

Removes all Geometry objects from the collection.
Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeometryCollection, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
CloneCore(Freezable)
CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this GeometryCollection object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
CloneCurrentValueCore(Freezable)
Contains(Geometry)

Returns a value that indicates whether the collection contains the specified Geometry.
CopyTo(Geometry[],Int32)

Copies all of the Geometry objects in a collection to a specified array.
CreateInstanceCore()
FreezeCore(Boolean)
GetAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore(Freezable)
GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.
IndexOf(Geometry)

Searches for the specified Geometry and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.
Insert(Int32,Geometry)

Inserts a Geometry into a specific location within the collection.
Remove(Geometry)

Removes the first occurrence of the specified Geometry from this GeometryCollection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the Geometry at the specified index from this GeometryCollection.

    Parameters

      The number of Geometry objects that the collection is initially capable of storing.

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of geometries contained in the GeometryCollection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of geometries contained in the GeometryCollection.

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the Geometry at the specified index position.

    public System.Windows.Media.Geometry this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the Geometry to get or set.

    Property Value

    • Geometry

      The Geometry at the specified index.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The attempt to modify the collection is invalid because the collection is frozen (its stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true).

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      index is less than zero.

      -or-

      index is equal to or greater than stem.Windows.Media.Animation.DoubleKeyFrameCollection.Count*.

    Creates a modifiable clone of this GeometryCollection, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

    public System.Windows.Media.GeometryCollection Clone ();

    Returns

    • GeometryCollection

      A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

    Remarks

    This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

    For more information, see Clone.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.

    public System.Windows.Media.GeometryCollection.Enumerator GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • GeometryCollection+Enumerator

      An GeometryCollection+Enumerator that can iterate through the collection.

  • IndexOf(Geometry)

    Searches for the specified Geometry and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire collection.

    public int IndexOf (System.Windows.Media.Geometry value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Geometry

      The Geometry to locate in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire collection, if found; otherwise, -1.

    Remarks

    The collection is searched forward starting at the first Geometry and ending at the last Geometry.

    This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to the value of Count. That is, this method is an O(n) operation, where n is equal to Count.

    This method determines equality by calling Equals.
